com.p4535992.util.file

Class SimpleParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.p4535992.util.file.SimpleParameters

  • public class SimpleParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility to read parameters from a string of name-value pairs or an array of string, each containing a name-value pair.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleParameters() 
      SimpleParameters(java.lang.String[] nameValuePairs)
      Construct the parameters from an array of name-value pairs using equals '=' as the separator.
      SimpleParameters(java.lang.String[] nameValuePairs, char separator)
      Construct the parameters from an array of name-value pairs, e.home. from "main( String[] args )"
      SimpleParameters(java.lang.String allNameValuePairs, java.lang.String pairSeparators, char nameValueSeparator)
      Construct the parameters from a string

      • SimpleParameters

        public SimpleParameters()

      • SimpleParameters

        public SimpleParameters(java.lang.String allNameValuePairs,
                java.lang.String pairSeparators,
                char nameValueSeparator)
        Construct the parameters from a string
        Parameters:
        allNameValuePairs - A string of the form "param1=name1 param2=name2".
        pairSeparators - A list of characters that separate the name-value pairs, e.home.
        nameValueSeparator - The character that separates the name from the values, e.home. '='

      • SimpleParameters

        public SimpleParameters(java.lang.String[] nameValuePairs,
                char separator)
        Construct the parameters from an array of name-value pairs, e.home. from "main( String[] args )"
        Parameters:
        nameValuePairs - The array of name-value pairs
        separator - The character that separates the name from its value

      • SimpleParameters

        public SimpleParameters(java.lang.String[] nameValuePairs)
        Construct the parameters from an array of name-value pairs using equals '=' as the separator.
        Parameters:
        nameValuePairs - The array of name-value pairs

      • setDefaultValue

        public void setDefaultValue(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Set a default value, i.e. set this parameter to have the given value ONLY if it has not already been set.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the parameter.
        value - The value of the parameter.

      • parseNameValuePairs

        public void parseNameValuePairs(java.lang.String[] nameValuePairs,
                       char separator,
                       boolean overWrite)
        The parse method that accepts an array of name-value pairs.
        Parameters:
        nameValuePairs - An array of name-value pairs, where each string is of the form: "'separator'"
        separator - The character that separates the name from the value
        overWrite - true if the parsed values should overwrite existing value
